info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 16 at 5:10AM PST until November 16 at 8:15AM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Los Angeles.
* WHEN...Until 815 AM PST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 506 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated a line strong storms over southeastern Los Angeles County producing heavy rain. Short-duration intense bursts of rainfall may occur across the advisory area. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Long Beach, Whittier, Alhambra, West Covina, Pasadena, Glendora, Carson, Port of Los Angeles, Pico Rivera, Santa Fe Springs, Montebello, Norwalk, Downey, Commerce, Hacienda Heights, Monterey Park, El Monte, Bellflower and Cerritos. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM PST THIS MORNING
